cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: near the extreme southwest Florida peninsula
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeast Gulf of Mexico, then turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (near the LA/MS–AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ochlockonee River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line in the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at 08:00 AM EDT 12-Sep-2020
weather_observation.impacted_coast: west-central and southern Florida today, then the entire northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle through mid-week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated 6" totals forecast for west-central FL)
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (mainly 35–40 mph) possible today as the center passes just south of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the immediate Manatee County shoreline; mainly elevated surf and rip-currents
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches common with isolated 6 inches, producing a flash-flood threat around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado possible today over southern and west-central Florida
